sentence.Network_en: Kevin wanted a lick of Sarah's lollipop.
sentence.Network_cn: 凯文想舔一下萨拉的棒棒糖.

sentence.Network_en: Molly Mahoney : I asked for a lollipop and I got lemur!
sentence.Network_cn: 莫莉·马奥尼: 我想要一根棒棒糖,却得到了一只狐猴!

sentence.Network_en: The child put out his tongue and licked his lollipop.
sentence.Network_cn: 那孩子伸出舌头舔着棒棒糖.

PerfectNetExp.abs: ...是明天”创作了剪贴画《什么使今日家庭变成如此不同、有魅力？》，他从画报上剪下一个肌肉男，手里拿着一根棒棒糖，上书三个字母“POP”，既是英文“棒棒糖”（lollipop）的结尾，又是英文“流行、时髦”的意思。由此，“波普艺术”（Pop Art）一词诞生。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: perhaps from dialect lolly 'tongue' + pop

entry.def: A lollipop is a sweet consisting of a hard disc or ball of a sugary substance on the end of a stick.

means.word_mean: 1. ice cream or water ice on a small wooden stick;

sentences.sentence: "in England a popsicle is called an ice lolly"
